roleset.name: state of peace

example.name: make_peace-l: LVC, typical usage
example.text: Let 's make peace in our hearts !

example.name: make_peace-l: Biblical
example.text: When all the kings who were vassals of Hadadezer saw that they had been routed by Israel , they made peace with the Israelites and became subject to them .
example.umr: (p / peace-01 :ARG0 (p2 / person :refer-person 3rd :refer-number plural) :ARG1 (a / and :op1 p2 :op2 (p3 / person :refer-number plural :mod (c / country :op1 "Israel"))) :aspect performance :modal-strength full-affirmative)

example.name: peace-n: Arg0 only, nominal
example.text: The peace of God came to her .
example.umr: (p / peace-01 :ARG0 (g / god) :ARG1 (p2 / person :refer-person 3rd :refer-number singular) :aspect inceptive :modal-strength full-affirmative)

example.name: peace-n: Of phrase that is arg1 instead
example.text: Counting the hours until she can return to the peace of her field .

example.name: peaceful-j
example.text: If they are so peaceful why not allow UN inspectors in .

roleset.note: PEACE-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, Part 5; adjectival 'peaceful' based on BOLT-6. Framed by Claire. (from peace.01-n)
PEACEFUL-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from peaceful.01-j)
IN_PEACE, AT_PEACE NOTES: added by Julia during :domain retrofits for UMR. Also noticed that the :ARG0 and :ARG1 have been annotated inconsistently, so fixed examples, and added an :ARG2.
